intro: Muehlenbeckia tamnifolia var. tamnifolia, commonly known as silver matted everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive silver-white, velvety leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and unique foliage.
